column10: EarthEnable is a construction platform that provides training for local masons to craft durable earthen floor.
column11: EarthEnable is a construction platform that provides training for local masons to craft durable earthen floor.  Traveling to Rwanda with the Stanford class “Entrepreneurial Design for Extreme Affordability”, in 2013, four Stanford students were tasked with their partner organization – The Mass Design Group - to design a product or a service that would make homes or communities healthier. They first sought to understand how sub-optimal homes affected physical and emotional health outcomes and were shocked to discover the significant health problems that dirt floors cause. Eliminating a dirt floor from the home results in dramatic reductions in childhood asthma, diarrhea, malnutrition, and parasitic infestations.

column10: Easyclass is a non-profit organization offering FREE Learning Management System.
column11: Easyclass is a Learning Management System (LMS) that allows educators to create digital classes whereby they can store the course materials online; manage class discussions; give assignments, quizzes and exams; monitor due dates; grade results and provide students with feedback all in one place.  Easyclass allows teachers/professors and students to communicate, collaborate, share and learn in a private, secure and user-friendly platform.  HOW IS IT DIFFERENT FROM OTHER LMSs? Unfortunately, LMSs normally cannot be afforded by all schools and universities. However, with the introduction of web-based LMS, Easyclass.com; teachers, professors and students now can have access to all the digital tools they need for learning – and for FREE. Easyclass sets out to disrupt the LMS industry by creating an EASY TO USE, yet powerful software system that will be the new standard for open technology in education.   Different from the traditional LMS providers, Easyclass also has online discussion forums as part of its core features, which are instrumental in enhanced learning experience. Online discussions promote collaborative exploration and critical thinking and hence foster deeper understanding among students towards the subject matter.  Easyclass is also a social network for teachers and professors. Educators can create groups with their colleagues and can share educational content with each other and discuss about new trends.  We aim to democratize education among the learning community by giving FREE access to the platform.   WHAT IS THE REVENUE MODEL OF EASYCLASS? Our business model is very different from other LMS providers as our platform is completely free of charge. It boils down to the idea that a platform with millions of students and instructors is very valuable, because it could be leveraged for distributing content such as educational applications, videos and digital books. There are many possibilities for the future, but right now our focus is on building the platform and providing a great experience to our users.  WHAT IS IT THAT MAKES EASYCLASS A SECURE AND PRIVATE ENVIRONMENT? -Easyclass platform targets only educators and students.  -Digital classes on Easyclass.com are created and managed by the teachers/professors. -Teachers/Professors have full administrative rights on student participation in their class. o  Students need an access code to join the class. If a student shares the code outside the class, the teacher can change it, without affecting students who are already enrolled in the class. o  Teachers can delete posts and remove class members.  o  Teachers may choose to receive automatic notification of student postings into the class before they are published on class walls. o  Anonymous posting is not possible. -The content created within the digital classes can be viewed by the class members only as they are effectively closed groups.  -Private conversation between students is not possible. Students may only communicate to the whole class or the teacher, which reduces opportunities for cyber-bullying. -If a school upgrades (free feature to be launched soon) to the institutional features, the school admin can audit all teacher and student activity.  -Parental access to their children’s posts/grades and to the teacher is an optional feature, which is also to be launched soon.  -Easyclass does not have any advertisements. -Easyclass is hosted on Amazon Cloud / Ireland.  BENEFITS TO TEACHERS/PROFESSORS -It’s easy to learn and use: The interface works like Facebook but is even easier to use. Easyclass.com is not overloaded with complicated features and presents a user-friendly interface.  -Time saving. Imagine you have to grade 143 tests comprising 50 multiple choice questions each! Easyclass will do it for you.  -No more photocopying, carrying and grading stacks of paper and writing comments out. All of this can be done online for your assignments, tests and quizzes whenever wherever you are.  -Enhanced learning: In today's classrooms, there is often limited time to cover topics fully. When Easyclass is used as a learning platform, additional resources can be used to enhance learning. -Great platform for Blended Learning initiatives: If you are looking to incorporate more digital content in your curriculum and looking for a robust platform that is affordable (like, free!) then Easyclass may be a perfect fit. -Continuous professional development: Easyclass Groups provide a way for teachers to connect with like-minded educators to exchange ideas, get advice and share resources. -Ability to stay connected with students: From snow days, swine flu, extended absences or just attending to a conference, teachers are able to be connected with their students.  -Safe environment: With no advertisements and a process which gives full control to the teachers/professors for managing the classes, Easyclass addresses the fundamental concerns of privacy and safety. The content created within the digital classes can be viewed by the class members only!  -Digital citizenship: Easyclass provides teachers the opportunity to teach responsible interaction via digital means, reinforcing good digital citizenship among students. -Support: The support Easyclass team offers is amazing! We get back to any queries within 24 hours.    BENEFITS TO STUDENTS -The platform is so easy that lower elementary students can be taught to use it. -Online resources and materials stored in digital classes are at the fingertips of the users. -Easyclass allows students not only to learn from their teachers but also from other students.  -Online discussions promote collaborative exploration and critical thinking and hence foster deeper understanding among students towards the subject matter.  -When students interact with their teachers outside the class, their attitude towards the teachers changes dramatically in a positive way.  -Students build their skills of becoming independent and responsible by logging in to view and submit assignments and hence monitor progress. This is something they would normally experience in college and in their career. -Students can submit quizzes and see their results immediately (except for short answer questions). -Easyclass promotes student confidence. Some of the teachers on Easyclass say that one student who isn’t comfortable speaking up in the classroom is opening up online. -Using Easyclass gives students the feeling of using a social-networking site without having to mix their personal lives with their school lives. -Students enjoy the interaction Easyclass brings in the classroom on this 24/7 online environment.

column10: Envision Blue/Green was founded by Andea Correll in 2012.

Envision Blue/Green is an environmental education and activism business that offers products and services to people or organizations of any kind that cater to kids, youth, &/or adults seeking to educate people about the environment. We teach about the earth's natural eco-systems--the beauty and ways of nature and about environmental problems that urgently need to be addressed.   Company founder and director, Andrea Correll believes it is imperative that we lead people toward making lifestyle changes--small steps that will help create a healthier planet. And that we encourage and inspire people as global citizens, to look beyond their own borders, to seek creative solutions, and to take action both locally and globally that will help resolve or improve problems that affect peoples around the world, now and in the future. Our special emphasis is on youth service learning because our young people are the generation with the most at stake in the health of the planet they will inherit.  But Envision Blue/Green is more than a business. It is a movement. We are actively seeking caring global citizens to join us in envisioning a brighter future and working to make it happen.

column11: Feelipa had its origin in 2009, when the author, Filipa Nogueira Pires, began an investigation with the aim of making color accessible to as many people as possible, particularly for people with some kind of visual impairment. Over several months of contact with visually impaired children, it was possible to develop, refine and validate this color code. These children were the ones who made the project possible.

We want you to be the best parents possible and to help families achieve clear communication and an honest approach to problem solving.  We admire emotional children who are in touch with the needs of others and believe that gender equality should start at home. We want our young one’s success, as ours should be, to be defined by doing amazing things that benefit others and not just ourselves. column10: Fusion Housing, a leading provider of housing and support services based in West Yorkshire
column11: Fusion Housing are a non-profit making charity working to help individuals in Kirklees who are experiencing housing related problems and need support with learning and employment.  Fusion Housing was created in 2010 but its roots in Kirklees go back much further. Fusion Housing grew out of the joining of SHAP which supported young people to be able to successfully maintain and keep their tenancies, and CHAS who’s basis in Kirklees was providing housing advice.  As the organisation has grown the services they provide has developed. Currently they run:  A range of support services for young people across Kirklees, including Young Parents, Refugees and Asian Women.  They have a Bond Bank scheme to help individuals that do not have children, and on low income and who are in band C/D/E with the council to secure a private rented property in the Kirklees area. (subject to meeting their bond bank criteria and background checks)  You can access advice and specialist Legal Help in Housing matters and representation at the local county courts at Housing Possession hearings.  They provide a range of informal and accredited learning opportunities, information, advice and guidance to support young people into education, employment and training.  Weekly work clubs are held in Dewsbury and Huddersfield to assist jobseekers of all ages to find, apply and get into work.  Their Recycling Project ‘Think Smart Recycle' provides recycled furniture and white goods free to people on low incomes. This service is run in partnership and can be accessed in different ways depending on your circumstances. Fusion can only make a referral directly for its own current clients.  Their 'Think Smart Recycle' charity shop in Dewsbury is also a new and affordable way of accessing goods for both you and your home.  They are also a base for North Kirklees food bank and you can access food packs from their shop base in Dewsbury or from their partner agencies that may be more local to you.  All of their services are non- judgemental, open to a diverse community and have been designed with your needs in mind. If you need help you can access their services through their drop in service, calling us, emailing us, or ask an existing worker to refer to us if you are involved with other agencies.  Welcome to Fusion Housing.

column10: GestVision, Inc. is commercializing a point of care diagnostic test for preeclampsia
column11: GestVision, Inc. is commercializing a point of care diagnostic test for preeclampsia.  The pregnancy-related condition is often characterized by the symptoms of high blood pressure and protein in the urine. Left untreated, the condition can lead to seizures and even death.  Preeclampsia is an equal opportunity problem and is of concern in both developed and developing nations.  The US is not immune and sees preeclampsia as a growing problem.

column10: The UK's leading educational website
column11: Getting-in reinvents online educational advice and proves a hit with students  The world of education is moving increasingly online, with students, teachers and parents alike now making heavy use of educational resources on the web to study and plan their next career, training or educational steps. Nowhere can this trend be seen more clearly than through the example of Getting-in, an educational portal that caters for every conceivable area of life that secondary-level children, students and career-minded young people could need as they prepare themselves for their futures.   It has already enjoyed phenomenal success, building up a dedicated online following and experiencing an explosion in its readership base. This hasn’t just taken the form of visitors to the site, but also students getting involved through its social media presence, such as its Twitter feed, which keeps students updated with crucial information about areas such as open-day dates and other developments in the world of careers and education. In part the popularity of the site is down to the quality of the resources that it offers. Created by professional writers and careers and education experts, the quality of its advice articles and study resources is unparalleled. Students looking for advice on where to apply to university get insightful and practical advice from is Applying section, while GCSE and A-Level students have access to revision guides for all of the most popular secondary-level subjects that bring the curricula to life. Students can book on to open days all over the UK and courses.  However, what has really set Getting-in apart from other educational sites and made it such a hit with young people is that it pays every bit as much attention to the needs of young people who want to head into the world of work or training rather than continue with their studies, or people who have not yet made up their minds about such dilemmas. It offers a huge range of articles and guides on finding job opportunities, taking a gap year, exploring training options and even setting up a business. In an age where higher education carries a considerable financial burden, young people are looking more than they have done for several generations for equally rewarding opportunities, something that Getting-in seems to be one of the very first sites to recognize. Getting-in has also made itself popular through some highly innovative extra features, such as an extensive database of university and college profiles profiles. Also a calendar of open days with a booking system, and a wide selection of special offers for students at the UK’s most popular high-street stores and restaurants. With the momentum behind Getting-in looking to be unstoppable—the site has been receiving more and more visitors every single month since it was launched—not only is it proving that the future of education advice and resources lies online, but it is also leading the way in defining the possibilities of how the Internet can help young people best prepare for their futures in an ever-more competitive job market and an increasingly expensive educational world.

column10: Health Guru Media is the provider of health video on the web.
column11: Healthguru.com is the destination site for health video on the web with 99 million views per month (comScore Video Metrix, August). Our unique approach to health education was developed specifically for the video audience and is differentiated in three key ways: - Category Focus: Healthguru.com focuses on the health topics that matter most to today's audience, including: diet and fitness, mental & emotional health, sexual health, pregnancy, baby health, drugs & alcohol, as well as information on more than 125 different health conditions. - Medium: The modern health consumer seeks out an immersive, rich media experience on the web, and video has proven to be a more engaging medium. Healthguru.com has the largest health video library online, and interactive applications to offer our audience the experience it expects. - Editorial Approach: World-class information providers know that creating truly engaging content is the way to ensure that information becomes learning. That's why Healthguru.com is dedicated to making our content as interesting and, when relevant, entertaining, as it is useful. All Healthguru.com content is created or selected by our editorial team and is rigorously reviewed for medical accuracy, objectivity and balance. column10: Hello World is an online programming school for children 8-16 years old.

column11: Positive school climate and culture is what every school strives for. Rethinking traditional discipline policies, building programs that recognize students in a positive way. Hero is a school-wide data capture, collection and analysis platform. We built the concept of student behavior analytics.  Across the country, schools are challenging themselves to create positive school climate and culture. Rethinking traditional discipline policies and building programs that recognize students in a positive way. The goal is to recognize students for the positive behavior traits they are exhibiting. Students get incentives for learning important social skills. The cast of people involved with student behavior is expanding. Classroom teachers, administration, parents and the students themselves want to work together. All have significant impact on learner development. These shifts demand new ways to capture and analyze behavior in schools. Accurate data capture and analysis tools are critical to behavior development and climate/culture transformation. Hero is a school-wide data capture, collection and analysis platform. We give new visibility to school/district-wide student behavior analytics.

column10: History Adventures, World of Characters presents a fresh approach to history education, designed for the digital generation.
column11: The future of learning is now. History Adventures, World of Characters is a next gen, fully interactive, cross-platform digital learning series created by Spencer Striker, PhD, Digital Media Design prof Northwestern University in Qatar. The product went live in 2020 with Revolutions & Industrialization (1750-1900) published to Apple Books. After receiving excellent press and reviews, in media ranging from education technology to screenwriting, the product went on to win the Horizon Interactive Gold Award for Best Education app. The newest work, Empires & Interconnections (1450-1750) went live on Apple Books in Oct of 2020, followed by a successful port of Revolutions & Industrialization to Chromebooks in Nov of 2020. In Dec of 2020, History Adventures, World of Characters became Shortlisted for Best Educational App at the 2020 Reimagine Education Awards (the ‘Oscars’ of Education).  From Oregon Trail to Civilization to Assassin’s Creed: History Adventures, World of Characters synthesizes the best elements from the legacy of learning games while introducing new features, design concepts, and affordances. This digital learning series introduces creative techniques, including historical flash fiction, dynamic cinemagraphs, 2.5D, Immersive 3D, 360 panorama, interactive infographics, choose your own adventure, sound design, original music, and adaptive assessment.  From the gardens of Babylon to the stockyards of Chicago, students will explore five millennia of amazing interactive content with ever more to come. History Adventures, World of Characters presents a fresh approach to history education, designed for the digital generation. This interactive learning experience combines mobile entertainment technology with the power of narrative design—bringing the pages of history to life.

Military and missionary families who move around frequently love the ease of at least keeping their children's school consistent throughout moving.  All of the resources needed are included with tuition with the exception of classic literature from library resources.  They have licensing agreements,  with the top curriculum resources in the industry providing a superior education.  This market is not only growing in the United States but globally.  Australia, New Zealand, South Korea and many other countries which will be presented on another spreadsheet.

column10: HourVille, an online social platform, lets users buy and sell anything that can be priced by the hour by providing interactive online tools.
column11: HourVille is a marketplace where people buy and sell virtually anything that can be priced by the hour — services, rentals, places, classes.  The company provides interactive online tools for both buyers and sellers.   Local Search — tag-based local search within a zip code radius for buyers to find local providers of services, rentals, places, and classes in target categories such as lessons, tutoring, babysitting, photography, party entertainment and equipment, massage therapy, dance halls and other venues, and art, computer, and other classes.  Multimedia Profiles — Sellers post descriptions, pictures, video, documents, references and testimonials.  Online Schedule Management — Sellers create a schedule for their services and post their availability to their profiles via an interactive calendar. Sellers can sync their schedules with other calendar applications via an iCalendar export. Buyers book and buy time directly through the sellers' interactive calendars at HourVille.com.   Ratings and Reviews — Buyers leave feedback for sellers after services have been delivered. Sellers build a community reputation and buyers make informed purchasing decisions based on seller reputation.   Marketing and Promotional Tools — Third-party web site support and integration is available through tools such as a widgets (including Facebook), and links and buttons that sellers embed in Craigslist and other online classifieds postings and personal and company web sites. The links, buttons, and widgets pull buyers back to sellers' HourVille profiles and interactive calendars.  Pricing, Payment and Auctions — Sellers set prices for hourly service time slots via fixed price or auctions. Buyers buy and pay for services through PayPal and Google Checkout integration.

column10: IBSfri Swollen and upset stomach? Join our IBS-school online and get quick help.
column11: Stress stomach, bloating, stomach milk - IBS is a functional gastrointestinal disorder that is more common than you think. Estimates indicate that approximately 15-20% of the world population have IBS, but according to recent studies, 25% of the population in Sweden recurring stomach problems every week and as many as 73% have had problems at some time in the past year. Most of those seeking treatment are women 20-65 years. Among men, the number of unreported large part due to the number of men who seek care less. Among children and adolescents, the number who are diagnosed with IBS. Those receiving IBS is often high-performance, active people. It has long been known that psychological factors are important in IBS and the anxiety and stress can worsen the disease.

column10: JustMilk is a nonprofit developing a novel device for delivering life-saving drugs or nutrients to breastfeeding infants.
column11: JustMilk is a nonprofit developing a novel device for delivering life-saving drugs or nutrients to breastfeeding infants. When worn by a mother during breastfeeding, it releases medicine or nutrients contained in the device into the milk directly consumed by the infant. The device could administer antibiotics, analgesics, antiretrovirals, antimalarials, vitamins or other compounds. It contains the entire dose of medicine inside of it, so no literacy is required to measure out a dose. It could be disposable, overcoming hygiene concerns in paediatric drug delivery. It does not require refrigeration, like many liquid medications do. Furthermore, it is used during breastfeeding, which may increase patient compliance and promote breastfeeding. Although it could be a life-saving intervention in low-resource settings, it could additionally be a practical and convenient product in any regional market.

column10: K12Planet is a revolutionary web site that bridges the gap between school and home and allows school districts.
column11: K12Planet® is a revolutionary web site that bridges the gap between school and home and allows school districts to build a powerful online learning community.  Available to any school district currently using Chancery's Win School®, Mac School® or Chancery SMS™ student information systems, K12Planet provides an easy-to-use, secure, and comprehensive school-to-home portal that gives parents and students instant access to grades, attendance, homework assignments, and school activities.  Best of all, K12Planet relieves teachers and administrators of the time-consuming burden of double data entry. That's because K12Planet is updated automatically from the school district's student information system. Now school districts can leverage their existing technology investment to provide parents and students with information crucial to academic progress. Until K12Planet, information this useful was never this easy to provide.  By giving students access to faster and more comprehensive feedback on their own performance, K12Planet empowers kids to take control of their academic progress. Other features help students organize their schedules, set their priorities, and access learning resources. And K12Planet is completely free of advertising and sponsorships.

column10: Kids Quizine is a local and organic lunch service for children in nursery to 8th grade.
column11: Kids Quizine is a local and organic lunch service for children in nursery to 8th grade.  We save parents time, by delivering  lunches to their  kids school. We provide your children with nutrient rich, delicious foods that are made with fresh local and organic food.

column10: Kids Read Now is a non-profit organization designed to eliminate the summer reading slide for hundreds of schools from coast to coast.
column11: Kids Read Now is a non-profit organization designed to eliminate the summer reading slide for hundreds of schools from coast to coast. The non-profit organization programs that parents provide summer contact info, and agree to help with summer reading and students read a book and talk about it with parents and families attend reading night and receive first 3 books. Kids Read Now was founded on October 29, 2010, and is based in Troy, Ohio, USA.

column10: The Kids Write Network (KWN) program is a 5 step patent pending process that is designed to teach children ( aged 8+) how to write.
column11: The Kids Write Network (KWN) program is a 5 step patent pending process that is designed to teach children ( aged 8+) how to write moral lesson books using their own personal experiences ( fictional names and characters). The mission of the program is for children to share their voices, to know that they matter and to help other children overcome their obstacles and challenges. Thus far, the engagement level in schools is at 98%. The dynamics between parent, teacher and student are positively impacted simply because of this new platform of communication that allows us as adults to go into the world of children, understand their behaviour, what triggers certain bad behaviours while offering them this tool to be able to better understand themselves in order to make better choices in the future. This is authentic, reflective writing where every book must define a solution to the conflict created by the children, who are the authors. Social disorders such as cyber bulling and bullying have been written about using this platform that has actually given teachers a better understanding of their students . The parents use these books as great ''talk pieces'' that help the children feel more comfortable and less alone in the world. They are proud to share their stories knowing they are helping other children. In the hospital setting where this was piloted as well, the program fell under the umbrella of '' improving the quality of life for patients'' as it allowed them to take a journey about their lives in order to help others who may be going through the same thing. It distracts them from their illness. The program has been called '' the children's voice'' as Iman, our last patient who CHOSE to use this program knowing full well she was dying spent every last minute writing her story to help encourage other children knowing full well she would never live to see her story published. We give children voices.

column10: KidsChaupal is a comprehensive service curation platform for creative and technical interest discovery.
column11: KidsChaupal is a comprehensive service curation platform for creative and technical interest discovery. It has been designed keeping in mind the emerging needs of parents, teachers, and children to find new means to learn and cultivate knowledge.  From planning to implementation, its 360-degree approach emphasizes the child’s overall personality development by giving them expert mentorship and a global platform. It fosters strong learning abilities and value systems in the child while improving their competitive skills to achieve more. Its expertise lies in helping parents who struggle with limited time availability owing to professional and personal commitments.

column10: KidsWifi offers products designed to allow parents to filter online content on devices that use wifi.
column11: KidsWifi is an elegant wall-plug device that creates a new Wi-Fi network just for your kids. Adult content and ads are filtered. Parents' can set time limits and bedtimes from their phone. Give your kids the best of the Internet without worry!

column10: Kidslox is a mobile app that helps parents remotely control their children's mobile devices.
column11: Kidslox is an app that helps you to set boundaries for your children in the digital world, keeping them safe and setting limits on their screen time.

column10: Online Allowance/Chore Management System
column11: Kidzillions is an online allowance and chore management system that lets kids spend and save online.  Unlike other online allowance systems, Kidzillions combines the benefit of budgeting, saving and responsible spending, helping kids learn essential lessons about personal finance and accountability in a cashless society.  Kids love it because they're able to work for real money to buy real stuff easily, and parents love it because their kids are excited to save and, in a lot of cases, do extra chores around the house.

column10: Kinematics is the maker of Tinkerbots
column11: Tinkerbots is a toy building set with easy-to-add robotics that make it possible for young children (and adults, too) to create an endless number of toy robots simply by snapping together Tinkerbots’ patented “Powerbrain,” kinetic modules and passive pieces, and even LEGO bricks. No wiring or programming required.   Tinkerbots is like “living LEGOs.”  Tinkerbots is the perfect hands-on introduction to the world of robotics. While experiencing hours of fun, children won’t even notice that they are actually learning something extremely valuable and getting a solid foundation in technology.   Tinkerbots is not only for children; it’s for the entire family. It’s a toy that fascinates kids and parents alike, engaging them in playing together, and in sharing a learning experience. And with its Arduino-compatible microcontroller, Tinkerbots is also the perfect tool for schools and all the makers out there.

column10: KiraKira3D is a First 3D Modeling Mobile Application
column11: KiraKira3D is a First 3D Modeling Mobile Application. They are redesigning the way girls learn engineering, through online 3D printing classes.  They offer a rich and unique experience with their 3D printed packages, combining both the online 3D print class + the tangible 3D printed reward.  More broadly, KiraKira is an online community of learning, making and sharing. Through their 3D modeling and printing lessons, they teach engineering commands and transferrable skills to various STEM disciplines and careers, including but not limited to architecture, mechanical and aerospace engineering, and industrial design.

column10: Kizoom offers kid-friendly stories, activities, and interactive technologies that enable kids to realize their minds' potential.
column11: Kizoom inspires life-long learning and health through products that empower kids to know and grow their brains. They are motivated by two recent discoveries in neuroscience and psychology: 1. Our brains have the ability to grow and get stronger throughout our entire lives if we try new things and take on challenges. 2. Children who understand that their brains can grow and get stronger do much better in school and later in life.  Using kid-friendly stories, games and activities, and interactive technologies they communicate this idea to as many kids (and adults!) as they can in order to help them realize the power and potential of their own minds.

column10: Knowbox, an education mobile app start-up focused on helping students and teachers manage their homework.
column11: Established in 2014, Knowbox targets the K12 education field with two mobile apps currently helping students get the most from doing homework by providing personalized exercises.  Teachers can use the mobile apps to better manage student homework by avoiding repetitive labor and securing more time to help each student's unique challenges.  The company claims the two mobile apps currently have nearly one million daily active users, and plans to use the proceeds on building its own homework database.

column10: KoalaSafe is a childsafe wireless router that provides website blocking, time limits, and monitoring.
column11: KoalaSafe is a childsafe wireless router that provides website blocking, time limits, and monitoring. It allows parents to easily control, monitor, and manage the time their child spends online. It was founded in 2014 by Steve Pack and Adam Mills and is based in Broadway, NSW.

column10: Kodable is a programming curriculum for elementary schools.
column11: Kodable is a programming curriculum used by over 50% of US Elementary Schools.  Designed primarily for classroom use, Kodable starts teaching students about logical thinking at ages before many have learned to read. Kodable provides scripted lesson plans for teachers in a classroom setting, requiring no prior computer science knowledge to use. Additionally, Kodable provides an interactive game available in web browsers and on iPad that reinforces concepts taught in the classroom setting using a unique symbol and block-based language,

column10: Kytephone offers a free app that transforms an Android smartphone into a secure and fun smartphone for kids.
column11: Kyte is an easy parental control application that can be downloaded to any Android phone, activated, and then given to a child.  This app allows the child to make pre-approved phone calls and play only authorized games. The child will be unable to leave the app to access the rest of the Android phone’s features. Parents have full control over the applications from the browser and can also track the phone’s GPS online.  It has other features that enable parents to turn off SMS and Facebook during school hours, ban apps and games during school and bed time hours, monitor internet usage, prevent the usage of third party browsers, set time limits on games, check call history, track location in real-time, receive email reports about what their child has been doing, and full remote control from their phone, tablet or PC.

column10: Lanla transforms the power of customer experience into a driving force for the largest Canadian companies.
column11: Founded in 2002 by childhood friends Luc Brousseau and Christian Watier, Mont‑Saint‑Hilaire‑based Lanla specializes in measuring and managing the customer experience. Now a leading Quebec firm, Lanla comprises 60 employees and serves close to 100 major companies throughout the province. Whether revising a company’s strategy, updating service standards, developing a business culture centred on the customer experience, measuring the behaviour of customers in their natural environment (e.g., in store or online), or measuring the economic impact of customer experience‑related decisions, Lanla’s team of experts is unmatched.  Lanla is expanding its services with the mobile platform Wizper™, an AI driven mobile app that analyzes and interpret satisfaction surveys, online reviews, social media posts, and operational data for retail businesses, restaurants, hotels, financial institutions, and service companies. Wizper™ generates detailed and actionable advice, alerts, and learning resources so that managers can improve both their customers’ experience and their company’s performance.

column10: Latch Mobile takes the worry out of giving kids a smartphone with a subscription service.
column11: Latch Mobile takes the worry out of giving kids a smartphone with a subscription service keeps parents informed and keeps kids safe when there's harmful content, a dangerous conversation, or risky activity.  Their patent pending technology analyzes everything kids do on their devices and alerts parents just when kids are getting into trouble or need help—but without spying on everything else they do. You can't avoid the risks—like porn, drugs, sexting, and bullying—by monitoring screen time or controlling the apps that kids use.  But their machine intelligence can, and provides parents the information and resources they need to intervene before there are consequences. Stay informed, keep your kids safe, and know how to respond when there's harmful content, a dangerous conversation, or risky activity.

column10: A fun and interactive program teaching kids the fundamentals of entrepreneurship, design thinking, the lean startup and code.
column11: Lemonade Stand is a children's entrepreneurship program for 9-12 year olds that teaches them the fundamentals of design thinking, the lean startup philosophy, coding and developing augmented realities. The program has been rolled out across Australia and Singapore. With up to 60% of today’s jobs subject to being replaced in the next 10 to 15 years, kids can’t afford not to learn entrepreneurial thinking. We are fast moving away from the industrial age and find ourselves in the information age - what employers value most is adaptability, critical thinking and the ability to effectively leverage information, technology and people to solve problems and create new value in the world. Lemonade Stand has been delivered to almost 1,000 children and has appeared on mainstream media outlets such as ABC TV, Weekend Sunrise, The Age and Sydney Morning Herald among others.

column10: Maily is an online tool for children to create e-mails using online pencils, brushes, photos, backgrounds, stamps and words.
column11: Maily lets kids as young as three years old send messages to people close to them, like parents and grand parents, close friends, or even educators. Maily accounts are super-safe: they are supervised by the parents, who have a simple dashboard where they can see what their kids are doing in Maily.  A lot of studies show that most apps kids’ use are mostly games, entertainment or education apps.   We want to change that. Maily focuses only on communication as a way to sharpen kids’ creative and social skills, when they’re still too young to use services like WhatsApp, Facebook or Twitter.

Greater risks for our children mean more responsibility for parents. Don't be the ''I had no idea'' parent.

column10: Montgomery Education Foundation is a primary & secondary education institution.

Since its founding, the foundation has focused its efforts on supporting the Alabama Reading Initiative, providing professional development for school administration and staff, the promotion of student achievement, the encouragement of public engagement, the development of school readiness (Pre-K programs) and the creation of the Brain Forest Summer Learning program.

column10: We believe firmly that we have the best instruction in the entire DFW area.
column11: We believe firmly that we have the best instruction in the entire DFW area. Whether your child is here to dance recreationally or to study the art of dance seriously, we have an unbelievable staff to accommodate both. Our instructors come from all over the country and now reside here in Dallas, where they are either pursuing a career in dance, choreography, or teaching professional dancers in local dance companies. They are perfect role models for any of our students and you will see instantly their passion for dance as well.  Our performing companies are for those children looking to study more intently. Through performing for charities and community events, we focus on the reward of giving back thru artistry. We also encourage our company members to pursue their dancing by auditioning for the Performing Art High Schools and showcasing their dance work in professional events in the area. We feel this is a more positive way to share their passion and leads them towards University programs and/or starting a career in dance.  At MoveMeant Illustr8ed, we believe that the study of dance is an art form, a long distance marathon. We support our students in following their dreams and finding their own paths.

column10: NYU Langone Medical Center is a clinical care, biomedical research, and medical education center.
column11: NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class, patient-centered, integrated, academic medical center, is one of the nation's premier centers for excellence in clinical care, biomedical research and medical education.   Located in the heart of Manhattan, NYU Langone is composed of four hospitals – Tisch Hospital, its flagship acute care facility; Rusk Rehabilitation; the Hospital for Joint Diseases, one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology; and Hassenfeld Children’s Hospital, a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children's health services across the medical center – plus the NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history.   The medical center's tri-fold mission to serve, teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care, education and research.

column10: Namihe is an online platform for primary school education.
Nanoogo is an online platform for kids to share their thoughts and creativity.
column11: Kids are creative and talented in many ways - Could be a great writer, artist or the next Edison. On Nanoogo, kids are the authors, creators, and inventors. And it's fun, social, and inspirational.  This is a unique approach as opposed to the current kids industry that is predominant with gaming, which is why Nanoogo is welcomed by parents. Nanoogo is a memory book full of their kids' creations.  We are also loved by educators - http://bit.ly/OHn9mj with over 100 schools and teachers signups.

column10: Natterhub is an educational social media SaaS platform created to prepare primary school children to thrive online.
column11: Natterhub, powered by TwinklHive, is a gated, educational social media platform designed specially for primary schools. With a distinctive mission to teach children to be safe and kind digital citizens, Natterhub provides pupils with an experiential learning environment. With a library of more than 300 interactive lessons, teachers can enjoy teaching digital literacy and online safety and untangle the potential risks for children on the internet. Having demonstrated impact in schools in over 60 countries around the world, Natterhub teaches children to approach the internet with kindness, empathy, resilience and critical thinking - skills that will last them a lifetime. A product born out of passion for education, drive for kindness and realism for what children really need to learn, Natterhub is a leading-edge platform that can make a real difference in children’s digital lives. Natterhub is the education that comes before children have their first mobile device.

column10: Naturebytes aims to combine hackable technology with a mission to spark kids' curiosity in the great outdoors.
column11: Naturebytes is bringing a different emphasis to this tech-plus-education space. It’s aiming to combine hackable technology with a mission to spark kids’ curiosity in the great outdoors. And given kids’ dictionaries have this year been jettisoning nature-related words such as acorn and buttercup, and adding in tech terms like broadband and ‘cut and paste’, there are perhaps signs technology risks becoming a little all consuming for ‘digital natives’.

column10: Nengdong Yingyu provides English learning method to the children aged between 6 to 14 years.
Neo Networks, Inc.'s youth enrichment and computer literacy program operates in Dekalb County and surrounding counties with its principle
column11: Neo Networks, Inc.'s youth enrichment and computer literacy program operates in Dekalb County and surrounding counties with its principle office being located at 4284 Memorial Drive, Suite # B, Decatur, GA 30032. This program is affordable and gets results.  This project is designed to educate the mind, to foster development, nurture the spirit, to educate the youth in the area of computer literacy, while also stimulating the desire for life long learning, intellectual curiosity, and promoting individual self-esteem.  Computer-based learning activities will be implemented for the expressed purpose of offering the youth in the community classes in developing computer skills and increasing knowledge of various computer programs. Neo Networks, Inc.'s youth enrichment and computer literacy program seeks to introduce and prepare the youth for the 21st century.  This program will also provide tutorial and mentoring services. Teachers instruct students and help them learn various computer programs. Programs that are currently being used in business offices will be taught in the classes, in order to provide the students with a marketable skill.  Neo Networks, Inc. will provide positive teaching and non-judgmental support. We seek to involve interested individuals in this program to serve as mentors in order to help the youth learn to be responsible and respectful. Neo Networks, Inc., will also focus on homework completion, performance reviews, and participation in extracurricular activities.  Each youth in the program will be involved in a broad range of activities. The youth enrichment and computer literacy program will be delivered in an array of modules: peer support, parent participation, a mentoring component, and educational activities.  The Peer Support Module will provide teaching on positive, non-judgmental methods of providing support. The training will include mediation and conflict resolution skills. Within group meetings, participants will be encouraged to support each other and to share their feelings.  The Parent Participation Module focuses on increasing parenting and communication skills and encouraging adults in the community to take advantage of educational and job placement opportunities. Parents will become active role models and coaches for their children.  The Mentoring Module is a strong facet of the youth enrichment and computer literacy program. Positive role models, especially males, are valuable resources for children. Mentors will be properly screened. Mentors will be matched by gender and will receive training and supervision through the program coordinator.  The Educational Module focuses on computer literacy training, completion of homework, and ongoing assessment of needs based on student performance. Students will learn various computer programs in order to enhance their skills and knowledge of the most current programs on the market.

column10: Nerdies is a new revolutionary education business opening in Fayetteville Arkansas, with plans to franchise in the near future.
column11: Nerdies is a new revolutionary education business opening in Fayetteville Arkansas, with plans to franchise in the near future. Nerdies focuses on all of the smart and curious ‘tech kids’ (aka nerds) out there who outside of traditional education channels do not have a place that they can come and pursue the things that they are interested in. Our nerds will have the opportunity to participate in various activities including attending a programming or gaming development class, build robots, learn various software platforms like Illustrator or Photoshop, explore new technologies, play video games with friends in the Nerdies Gaming Studio or just hang out and collaborate on their latest project idea in the Nerdies Caffeine Café.   Nerdies focuses on that large population of people who often just don’t fit in. They do not like sports, are six times more likely to play video games than ride a bike, could care less about the social scene, pay no attention to the latest fashion trends or care whether they are in the “popular” crowd. They are a group of smart inquisitive people who love to learn, explore new areas and just be themselves. Most of the world calls these people nerds, at Nerdies we call them our “nerds” and see them as a great business opportunity.

column10: We create tailored communication tools to put an end to loneliness.
column11: No Isolation is a Norwegian startup, founded in October 2015. We tackle loneliness and involuntary social isolation by developing communication tools that help those affected. Our first product is AV1, the telepresence robot designed to allow children and young adults with long-term illness to participate in their social and educational lives. AV1 was launched in August 2016 and currently helps around 500 children across thirteen countries. Our second product is KOMP, the one-button screen designed to improve the communication between generations and family members, regardless of technological skills. Through KOMP, seniors can receive messages, photos and video calls. As of today, more than 85,000 moments have been shared with KOMP. No Isolation has employees in three offices: Oslo, Amsterdam and London.

column10: Oddizzi is an e-learning resource and community that immerses children in the real world.
column11: Oddizzi is an e-learning resource and community that immerses children in the real world. They enable children – wherever they are – to ‘break out’ of their own world and join a global community of like-minded children.  Children using Oddizzi can view the world through the eyes of people who are passionate about the places they are sharing. Their growing body of carefully managed content builds a solid understanding of the people, places and cultures of the world. It is widely used in schools for geography and social studies, global citizenship topic work and to build research skills. It can support literacy topics and is a great CLIL resource for language-learners. Oddizzi's original learning content is produced by their community of teachers, travel-writers, geographers and sometimes the children themselves. Their informative pages include films, photographs, maps and quizzes. They are designed and written with an eye for detail and a consideration of how they might be used in the classroom to engage and inspire learners. Oddizzi members get involved by communicating together, using the safe ClassPals virtual postcard messenger, and by taking part in content creation projects to share on Oddizzi.com. In this way, their members develop their skills of enquiry, dialogue and digital citizenship.Explore their features in detail: discover how Oddizzi could benefit your children either at school or at home.

column10: Play My Way is an app that takes the form of multiple choice questions to interrupt phone use with education notifications.
column11: Play.My.Way is the smart, practical, and educational solution to children wasting too much time on their smart phones and tablets. At parent-specified intervals, Play.My.Way will interrupt any running application with an educational question, and will only return to the app once the question is answered. Parents have complete control over the grade levels (1-9), the subjects and chapters (Language Arts, Math, and Science), the time intervals, and other options. After a test is completed, parents can access a detailed report to see their child's performance as well as strength and weakness points.

column10: A DIY Minecraft Computer to teach electronics and programming
column11: Piper is a Minecraft toolbox for budding engineers that leverages kids' love of Minecraft to show them that building real gadgets is effortless and fun. At a time when technology pervades every part of our life, kids learn to passively USE technology, but not to CREATE with it. We believe that giving kids an opportunity to become creators rather than consumers, and to do it through a game their already understand and love is a powerful way to replace screen-time with build-time. Letting kids invent, tinker, and build in the physical world while they are young is the most powerful way to empower them to create the future.

column10: Pobble is the platform to find the best teaching resources, give pupils a global audience for their work, and to assess writing.
column11: Teachers use Pobble to find the best teaching resources, to give pupils an audience for their work, and to make moderation of writing easier. For pupils, the platform offers a fantastic opportunity to engage with their peers. For parents, it provides a unique way to connect with their child’s learning journey. A group of teachers based in North Yorkshire, England started Pobble in 2013. A true grassroots initiative, the founders aimed to inspire pupils and save teachers time. Before long, they were traveling throughout the UK delivering Pobble into the classroom. In 2017, Pobble won the EdtechX Global Super League of Startups, was a finalist for the BETT Awards, and was selected as one of the HundrED.org top education innovations. Pobble has been praised by authors such as Anthony Horowitz, Cressida Cowell, and Michael Morpurgo. Finally, Pobble has gained the support of prominent education leaders, and partners like Microsoft Accelerator, Oxford University Press, and Teachit Primary. Today, Pobble showcases over 100,000 pieces of writing, published by tens of thousands of teachers from all over the world. And this is just the beginning.

Recurious is a game development platform focused on developing educational games for kids.
column11: Recurious is a new game development platform that aims to help kids rediscover their curiosity.  Founded by James Miao, Recurious wants to create better educational games for children. Miao believes that there is a gap in quality game design for kids. As Miao explains, most kids games dress up education into gaming, which he compares to “covering broccoli with chocolate.”  He thinks that having a more thoughtful approach to design of kids’ games is essential for self-motivated learning because it immediately engages kids and then gives them just enough of an information gap where the actual curiosity element kicks in. And it’s this curiosity that helps kids actually learn while playing a hame.  The startup’s first title Dinorama, which is aimed at kids ages 7 through 12, is based around encouraging children to build a dinosaur theme park. The actual gaming and creative element centralizes around how to make the park successful from a financial standpoint.  In Dinorama, kids learn about earning, spending, and saving money by building amusements for their visitors, caring for their dinosaurs, and weathering events like rainstorms that increase maintenance costs and lower ticket sales.

column10: Founded in 2005, we at Red Rabbit believe that good nutrition is essential to a child’s academic growt

Whether it’s breakfast, lunch or just a snack—we are ready to help you make it happen in your school. In addition to our healthy meal service, we offer a wide variety of hands-on educational programs, specifically through gardening and cooking, to establish a child’s relationship with whole foods that will last into adulthood. column10: Rocketship is a non-profit network of public charter schools serving disadvantaged communities nationwide.
column11: Rocketship is a national non-profit network of public elementary charter schools serving low-income communities with limited access to excellent schools. Founded in 2006, Rocketship is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation whose mission is to eliminate the achievement gap by building a scalable and sustainable school model that propels student achievement in underserved communities across the country. The core of Rocketship’s instructional model is a teacher-led, technology supported approach to personalized learning that matches each student with the right content at the right time utilizing the right method of instruction. By deeply engaging parents in their student’s learning and the school community, Rocketship develops parents who become lifelong advocates for their children and their community. Working alongside parents, community organizations, districts, and other charter schools, Rocketship is catalyzing a movement to eliminate the achievement gap in our lifetime.

column10: School Places is an online marketplace that matches private school vacancies with parents looking for a place for their child.
column11: School Places is a unique online marketplace that matches private school vacancies with parents evaluating their child’s schooling options a year or two in advance.  By partnering with private schools, the site helps maximise the school’s revenue through the dynamic pricing of each and every vacancy, incentivising parents to take up places that would otherwise remain empty. School Places helps parents enrol their children into Australia’s leading private schools at a discounted rate.  Schools list their vacant places with full flexibility over the discount they set and the number of years the discount will apply. Parents can easily search for and claim a place at a private school that best suits their child’s needs.   School Places is truly a win/win/win for all parties involved: Schools maximise their revenue, incumbent parents share the benefits of a better funded school – better facilities, less pressure on future fee increases, and incoming parents can enrol their children in their desired school at a reduced rate.

column10: SchoolCare delivers free health technology for K-12 public schools to help school nurses deliver care and keep students safe.
column11: SchoolCare delivers free health technology for K-12 public schools to help school nurses deliver care and keep students safe. It is a digital health platform for the largest and most consistent health delivery system in the country. Their mission is to work with partners to provide a unified health record for every family.  SchoolCare leverages pediatric health data and this country’s most successful public health organization, the K-12 school system, to improve outcomes and learn about clinical health data outside of the provider’s office.  Traditional care coordination stops short of sending essential care instructions to School Nurses and thus increases the risk of stopped or inconsistent post-discharge care delivery. By closing the link in the pediatric care continuum, children stay healthy and get better faster.

column10: Schools measure outcomes without test scores & grades
column11: Schoolze is a context-based school success platform for K-12. Schoolze started as a simple messaging and newsletter scheduling web-app for a Pacific Grove preschool class in early 2015 with an objective to make parental communication and field trip photo sharing, private, secure and easy. The response we received from local parents and teachers was overwhelming, and the site witnessed 70%+ returning parents who visited the website every day. Intrigued by the engagement site generated, we went in researching the impact and found that for various reasons, our schools (and students) do not get enough parental involvement and that this lack of engagement is responsible for problems such as teen depression and high drop-out rates in high schools. Looking at the early traction, our founder, Avneesh Kumar quit his consulting director job and started building and scaling Schoolze full time with a mission to help schools increase parental engagement in a measurable way. He also initiated research in the classrooms to find key factors on how parental engagement leads to higher student achievement. In July 2015, Avneesh brought in his long-term colleague and friend Nirmal Kannan as a co-founder and technology head.  This turned out to be a crucial decision in the history of the company, as Nirmal transformed the platform into an engagement analytics platform and added much-needed fundraising options later. In building and scaling of Schoolze, we learned pretty early that almost every school needs funds to help students achieve more. This was what lead to critical insights which became paving stone for Schoolze becoming a fundraising platform. Today, Schoolze has proudly built technology which saves time for teachers, generates money for schools & education institutions, and provides actionable parental engagement insights to school and district administrators. Schoolze is currently working on linking the parental engagement to student achievement in the area of early childhood reading and writing and also aspires to make a parental advocacy product in 2017.

column10: Schoooools provides personal and social learning spaces to collaborate between learners and their educators.
column11: Schoooools provides you personal and social learning spaces that empower collaboration between learners and their educators, namely parents and teachers www.schoooools.com  Our mission is to make learning fun and easy especially for young kids born in this information age, but also to learners of all ages, including their educators.  Schoooools is developed by Tecla Colorida, a software company specialized in educational software based in Oporto, Portugal. www.schoooools.com  We recreate the classroom space in a digital environment on the web. Our social platform brings learners (from kids to adults), parents and teachers closer in a space were they can learn by doing, sharing, collaborating and playing.  It's interactive, fun and safe!  All school work is stored digitally, so parents can follow their children work, organize, and save it forever, so they can revisit it later, to learn, share or simply show it to the rest of the family or friends.

''Truly, SCOOTPAD has been a blessing to me and my students. Ever since we discovered this app, our class has worked hard daily to practice the Common Core Skills introduced in both Reading and Math. This app is AWESOME! WE LOVE IT!!!!!!'' - Michael Wesley Jr., 2nd Grade Teacher  ''Scootpad is one of the best resources for keeping my child on track in both Reading and Math. The tests are the perfect length and the questions are geared appropriately.''  Amy Blair, Parent of 1st Grader, Ohio  For more information, visit: http://ScootPad.com

column10: Seamless Toy Company develops tech-toys such as ATOMS, a plug-n'-play system that enables interactive functionality.
column11: Seamless Toy Company  enable kids to be makers.  Their first product, ATOMS, is a system of plug-n-play sensors, motors, and action blocks for kids (and anyone) to add interactive functionality to their creations. ATOMS are fun, fast and don't require any electronics or programming skills to get going.  ATOMS work seamlessly with LEGO and other toys, can be sewn or velcro-ed onto fabrics, or bolted onto more permanent creations.  ATOMS work with iOS devices (Android soon), so users can control their ATOMS from their iPhone/iPod/iPad, and can also inversely control their iPhone from ATOMS.  ATOMS are sold through starter sets that show kids what each ATOM does through already-popular play experiences (imaginary characters and kid-scale play). However, we expect kids' interest in ATOMS to outlast the starter-set themes, as they go onto use ATOMS in their own creations.  ATOMS can also be bought individually for the ''from-scratch'' project doer, and we will be releasing a new ATOM every month to serve our enthusiastic repeat customers.

column10: Self-Employed Women's Association of India (SEWA) is a trade union for poor, self-employed women workers in India
column11: Self-Employed Women's Association of India (SEWA) is a trade union for poor, self-employed women workers in India. SEWA was founded in 1972 by the noted Gandhian and civil rights leader Dr Ela Bhatt. SEWA's main office is located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, and it works in several states of India. SEWA had a membership of 966,139 in the year 2008. SEWA members are women who earn a living through their own labour or small business. They do not obtain regular salaried employment with welfare benefits like workers in the organized sector. They are the unprotected labour force of India. Constituting 93% of the labour force, these are workers of the unorganized sector. Of the female labour force in India, more than 94% are in the unorganized sector. However their work is not counted and hence remains invisible. SEWA is strongly supported by the World Bank which holds it out as a model to be replicated elsewhere

Such entrepreneurs are typically driven by a mission to deliver higher quality education outcomes for children in their neighborhood. It is not uncommon for such schools to face a lack of funds to expand their classrooms and physical infrastructure, besides having inadequate access to academic and extracurricular tools for their students. This lack of capital is what Shiksha Finance aims to address, by providing finance and loans.

column10: Smart GPS Back Pack LLC is a Florida corporation that specializes in developing, producing and distributing its Captain Smart.
column11: Smart GPS Back Pack LLC is a Florida corporation that specializes in developing, producing and distributing its Captain Smart educational product lines. Smart GPS Back Pack LLC and its executive, management and business development teams have the insight and capabilities to bring to the marketplace a series of early learning tools that will help promote, cultivate, and enhance interest and subsequent skills in young children, age two to five and above. Its products are geared toward reaching young children who are able or unable to attend Voluntary Prekindergarten (VPK).  Each year the US falls further and further behind the rest of the world in educational standards, performance and rankings (www.ed.gov, 2010.) To spark any child’s interest and provide them not only with early learning skills but also time to play while learning, Smart GPS has developed its Captain Smart USA cartoon characters and accompanying back packs, learning tools, media, and accessories that will be upgraded ongoing to keep pace with technology advancements. All products are bilingual English-Spanish and have the potential to be translated and marketed outside of North America. The additional GPS option for tracking location of children is unique to the Captain Smart product line. The animated, child-friendly characters teach positive life lessons, encourage gender-neutral exploration of role models, promote communication, and provide self-practice tools for learning basic skills.  Sales channels for the products are e-commerce online sales, infomercials, media distribution,   and traditional retail outlets. The Captain Smart product lines are projected to catch-on and proliferate much like a Snuggles or Hooked on Phonics. Serious interest, endorsements, and/or references have been received from a variety of parties, including but not limited to the Discovery Channel, Florida Governor Rick Scott, educators, entrepreneurs, and the ABC network.
